instruction: Which offences under the sections 354, 354A, 354B, 354C, 354D, 354E, 376B, 376C, 376F, 509, 509A, 509B have a bailable status?
output: All of them

instruction: Which Act is also known as The Uttar Pradesh Land Laws (Amendment) Act, 1974?
output: Uttar Pradesh Act 34 of 1974

instruction: What does section 219 state?
output: Section 219 states that when a person is accused of more than one offences of the same kind committed within the space of twelve months, he may be charged with, and tried at one trial for, any number of them.

instruction: Which body has exclusive power to make any law with respect to any matter not enumerated in the Concurrent List or State List, and can impose a tax not mentioned in either of those Lists, according to the constitution?
output: Parliament

instruction: Who can the court recall and re-examine during an inquiry, trial or other proceeding? Can the court summon anyone as a witness?
output: Yes, the court can recall and re-examine any person who has already been examined. Also, it can summon any person as a witness, or examine any person in attendance, even if they haven't been summoned as a witness.

instruction: Which act made the amendment to section 209 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 in its application to the State of Gujarat?
output: The Gujarat Act 30 of 1976, s. 2

instruction: What is the classification of the offence 376DB Gang rape on woman under twelve years of age?
output: Cognizable

instruction: What is the population requirement and structural composition for an area to be designated as a 'Metropolitan area' under Part IXA THE MUNICIPALITIES?
output: An area must have a population of ten lakhs or more, and must be comprised in one or more districts, consisting of two or more Municipalities or Panchayats or other contiguous areas to be designated as a 'Metropolitan area' under Part IXA THE MUNICIPALITIES.

instruction: What is the legal term for the situation when a person of unsound mind is released pending investigation or trial?
output: 330. Release of person of unsound mind pending investigation or trial.

instruction: Who is considered as a 'Judge' according to law?
output: The word 'Judge' denotes not only every person who is officially designated as a Judge, but also every person who is empowered by law to give, in any legal proceeding, civil or criminal, a definitive judgment, or a judgment which, if not appealed against, would be definitive, or a judgment which, if confirmed by some other authority, would be definitive.

instruction: Who can assume the administration of the area under the authority of a Council and for what period of time, according to the approval of the Legislature of the State?
output: The Governor can assume the administration of the area under the authority of such Council himself or place the administration of such area under the Commission appointed under the said paragraph or any other body considered suitable by him for a period not exceeding twelve months.

instruction: What is the penalty for causing disappearance of evidence of an offence if it's punishable with less than 10 years’ imprisonment?
output: Imprisonment for a quarter of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.

instruction: What does the industry or occupation of catching, processing and selling fish refer to?
output: It refers to fisheries.

instruction: Who might receive a monthly allowance for interim maintenance during the pendency of the proceedings?
output: The wife, child, father or mother of the person who is the subject of the proceeding.

instruction: When should every Proclamation under this article be laid before each House of Parliament?
output: Immediately after it is issued.

instruction: Can members of the Anglo-Indian community be appointed to posts other than those reserved for them?
output: Yes, members of the Anglo-Indian community can be appointed to posts other than, or in addition to, those reserved for the community if they are found qualified for appointment on merit as compared with the members of other communities.

instruction: What is the reference for the Chhattisgarh amendment to Section 164A?
output: The reference for the Chhattisgarh amendment to Section 164A is Vide Chhattisgarh Act 25 of 2015 s. 10.

instruction: What can the High Court or Court of Sessions direct any Magistrate to do?
output: Levy the amount due on a bond for appearance or attendance at such High Court or Court of Session.

instruction: Who does every Public Prosecutor, Additional Public Prosecutor and Special Public Prosecutor appointed by the State Government report to?
output: They are subordinate to the Director of Prosecution.

instruction: What provision can the Parliament make for the number of seats and delimitation of assembly constituencies in the Legislative Assembly of the State of Sikkim?
output: Parliament may make provision for the number of seats in the Legislative Assembly of the State of Sikkim which may be filled by candidates belonging to different sections of the population, and for the delimitation of the assembly constituencies from which candidates belonging to such sections alone may stand for election.

instruction: What can a Magistrate do upon receipt of a complaint of an offence they are authorised to take cognizance of?
output: The Magistrate may postpone the issue of process against the accused, and either inquire into the case himself or direct an investigation to be made by a police officer or by such other person as he thinks fit.

instruction: Does the tax levied by a State under article 246A form part of the Consolidated Fund of India or the Consolidated Fund of the State if used for payment of the tax?
output: No, the tax levied by a State under article 246A, if used for payment of the tax, does not form part of the Consolidated Fund of India or the Consolidated Fund of the State.

instruction: What is the consequence according to Indian law if a person voluntarily acquires the citizenship of any foreign State?
output: No person shall be a citizen of India if he has voluntarily acquired the citizenship of any foreign State.

instruction: What does article 481 pertain to?
output: Public servant concerned in sale not to purchase or bid for property.

instruction: What is the implementation date of the insertion by Act 5 of 2009?
What is the penalty for a crime that results in imprisonment for 6 months, or a fine of 1,000 rupees, or both?
output: The penalty is for knowingly furnishing false information to a public servant.

instruction: What is the punishment for erasure of mark denoting that stamps have been used?
output: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: Who is referred to instead of the Governor and Government of the State in the application of provisions to the Union territory of Mizoram?
output: The Administrator of the Union territory

instruction: If A intentionally kills Y, Z's child, under the influence of passion excited by a provocation given by Z, is it considered murder or culpable homicide?
output: It is considered murder as the provocation was not given by the child, and the death of the child was not caused by accident or misfortune in doing an act caused by the provocation.

instruction: What is the punishment for someone who neglects to aid a public servant demanding help in the execution of process or prevention of offences?
output: The punishment is simple imprisonment for 6 months, or a fine of 500 rupees, or both.

instruction: What happens when a person is convicted at one trial of two or more offences?
output: When a person is convicted at one trial of two or more offences, the Court may sentence him for such offences, to the several punishments prescribed therefor which such Court is competent to inflict.

instruction: Under article 240, for which Union territories may the President make regulations?
output: The President may make regulations for the Union territories of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Lakshadweep, Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Daman and Diu, and Puducherry.

instruction: What is the date on which the amendments made by Act 45 of 1978 became effective?

Which article allows the Governor of a State to entrust either conditionally or unconditionally to the Government of India or to its officers functions in relation to any matter to which the executive power of the State extends, with the consent of the Government of India?
output: Article 258A allows the Governor of a State to entrust these functions.

instruction: Who can adjudicate cases of criminal breach of trust?
output: Magistrate of the first class.

instruction: Who presides when the removal of the Speaker from his office is under consideration?
output: The Deputy Speaker does not preside when the removal of the Speaker from his office is under consideration.

instruction: What Act was substituted by Act 25 of 2005, s. 32, for sub-section (1)?
Who can be appointed by the State Government for a specific term for specific areas or functions?
output: Special Executive Magistrates

instruction: Can Every Minister and the Advocate-General for a State speak in, take part in the proceedings of, the Legislative Assembly of the State or, in the case of a State having a Legislative Council, both Houses, and speak in, and take part in the proceedings of, any committee of the Legislature of which he may be named a member?
output: Yes, they have the right to do so, but they are not entitled to vote.

instruction: What is the sentence for voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty?
output: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

instruction: Which form is a Magistrate’s order prohibiting the doing of anything on land or water when a dispute has arisen concerning the right of use of the property?
output: FORM No. 27 is used for this purpose.

instruction: What happens if a notice in writing signed by not less than one-tenth of the total number of members of the House of the People is given, of their intention to move a resolution for disapproving a Proclamation?
output: A special sitting of the House shall be held within fourteen days from the date on which such notice is received by the Speaker, or, as the case may be, by the President if the House is not in session.

instruction: Which chapter is about plea bargaining?
output: Chapter XXIA is about plea bargaining.

instruction: What is Form No. 41?
output: Form No. 41 is a Warrant after a commutation of a sentence.

instruction: What does section 381 discuss?
output: Section 381 discusses how an appeal to Court of Session is heard.

instruction: Under what law does the term 'detained' in this chapter refer to?
output: The term 'detained' in this chapter refers to being detained under any law providing for preventive detention.

instruction: What was the substitution made by Act 13 of 2013, s. 24 in the context of these crimes?
output: It was for entry relating to s. 354 (w.e.f. 3-2-2013).

instruction: What words were added to section 273 of the principal Act in Gujarat after 'in the presence of his pleader'?
output: The words 'or, as the case may be, through the medium of Electronic Video Linkage when the court on its own motion or on an application so directs in the interests of justice' were added.

instruction: What does the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, in Section 6, classify as Classes of Criminal Courts?
output: Section 6

instruction: What is the purpose of section 227?
output: Section 227 deals with discharge.

instruction: What does the Form No. 30 allow the accused to do?
output: Form No. 30 allows the accused to appear in person, to transmit a plea of guilty in writing and pay a fine, or to appear by pleader and plead guilty, authorising the pleader to make such a plea and pay the fine on their behalf.

instruction: Under what condition can the ban on printing or publication of trial proceedings in relation to an offence of rape be lifted?
output: The ban can be lifted subject to maintaining confidentiality of name and address of the parties.

instruction: What amendment was made to sub-section (3) of section 9 of the principal Act in West Bengal?
output: The following provisos were added: 'Provided that notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Code, an Addition.'

instruction: What is the topic of Chapter III in the text?
output: Power of Courts

instruction: Who advises on the form of accounts of the Union and of the States?
output: The President, on the advice of the Comptroller and Auditor-General of India.

instruction: What does the authority making a detention order consider to be against the public interest to disclose?
output: The authority making a detention order considers the facts which are not required by clause (6) to be against the public interest to disclose.

instruction: What is the information provided by Act 5 of 2009?
output: This information is not provided

instruction: Who can regulate the procedure of financial business in the Legislature of the State?
output: The Legislature of a State

instruction: Is it true that a Court shall not take cognizance of any offence punishable under Chapter VI or under section 153A?
output: Yes, it is true that a Court shall not take cognizance of any offence punishable under Chapter VI or under section 153A.

instruction: What does section 265L refer to?
output: Non-application of the Chapter.

instruction: What type of services do the Union agencies and institutions provide according to the Indian Constitution, especially in the fields of education, research, and crime investigation?
output: Professional, vocational or technical training, the promotion of special studies or research, scientific or technical assistance in the investigation or detection of crime.

instruction: Who has the power to transfer cases and appeals?
output: The High Court has the power to transfer cases and appeals.

instruction: Who has the power to order the Governor of Nagaland to cease having special responsibility for law and order, and under what circumstances?
output: The President has the power to order the Governor of Nagaland to cease having special responsibility for law and order, specifically when he is satisfied, based on a report from the Governor or otherwise, that it is no longer necessary.

instruction: Who can the accused apply to for compelling the attendance of any witness or the production of any document after he has entered upon his defence?
output: The accused can apply to the Magistrate after he has entered upon his defence.

instruction: What do holding an office of profit under the Government of India or any State, being of unsound mind as declared by a competent court, being an undischarged insolvent, not being a citizen of India, voluntarily acquiring the citizenship of a foreign State, or being disqualified by or under any law made by Parliament indicate?
output: These are some disqualifications for membership to the Legislative Assembly or Legislative Council of a State.

instruction: What is the consequence of threatening a public servant with injury to him or one in whom he is interested, to get him to do or abstain from doing any official act?
output: Imprisonment

instruction: What are some examples of a document?
output: Examples of a document include a writing expressing the terms of a contract, a cheque upon a banker, a power-of-attorney, a map or plan which is intended to be used as evidence, and a writing containing directions or instructions.

instruction: What is expected of a person summoned for the purpose of an investigation?
output: Every person so summoned shall be bound to attend and to answer truly all questions other than questions the answers to which would have a tendency to expose him to a criminal charge or to a penalty or forfeiture.

instruction: What is the official name for the Madhya Pradesh Act 61 of 1976?
output: The Madhya Pradesh Land Revenue Code (Third Amendment) Act, 1976

instruction: Within what period should the annual general body meeting of every co-operative society be convened after the close of the financial year?
output: The annual general body meeting of every co-operative society should be convened within a period of six months of close of the financial year.

instruction: What is the procedure in section 322?
output: The procedure in section 322 is in cases which Magistrate cannot dispose of.

instruction: What does sub-clause (g) of clause (1) of article 19 or clause (2) of article 29 not prevent the State from doing?
output: It does not prevent the State from making any special provision for the advancement of any economically weaker sections of citizens other than the classes mentioned in clauses (4) and (5). It also allows for special provisions for these economically weaker sections relating to their admission to educational institutions, including private ones, whether aided or unaided by the State, other than minority educational institutions referred to in clause (1) of article 30.

instruction: What is the compensation intended to cover for the person arrested?
output: The compensation is intended to cover his loss of time and expenses in the matter.

instruction: What shall the tribal areas in each item of Parts I, II and IIA and in Part III of the table appended to paragraph 20 of the Schedule be?
output: The tribal areas in each item of Parts I, II and IIA and in Part III of the table appended to paragraph 20 of this Schedule shall be an autonomous district.

instruction: When can the Magistrate make alterations in the allowance for the maintenance or interim maintenance?
output: The Magistrate can make alterations in the allowance for the maintenance or interim maintenance on proof of a change in the circumstances of any person receiving the allowance or ordered to pay it.

instruction: What does the act of trying to carry out a robbery or dacoity while possessing a weapon that could potentially cause death refer to?
output: This act refers to attempting to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with a deadly weapon.

instruction: What does section 410 allow?
output: To recall a case and try it himself.

instruction: What is the responsibility of the surety in a bail-bond?
output: The surety declares themselves responsible for the charged individual, ensuring that they will attend court on the specified day to answer to the pending charge. In case of the individual's default, the surety binds themselves to forfeit a certain sum of money to the government.

instruction: What does the Judge do if the accused pleads guilty under section 229?
output: The Judge records the plea and may, in his discretion, convict him thereon.

instruction: What is the classification of a crime that is both cognizable and nonbailable?
output: Personation of a juror or assessor

instruction: What is the penalty for using a false declaration known to be false as true?
output: Ditto

instruction: What if the person referred in sub-section (1A) is a person with mental retardation?
output: The Magistrate shall further determine whether the mental retardation renders the accused incapable of entering defense.

instruction: Which specific regions and states does this law not apply to, as described in its Part 243M?
output: Part 243M does not apply to the Scheduled Areas referred to in clause (1), and the tribal areas referred to in clause (2), of article 244, the States of Nagaland, Meghalaya and Mizoram, the hill areas in the State of Manipur for which District Councils exist under any law for the time being in force, and the hill areas of the District of Darjeeling in the State of West Bengal for which Darjeeling Gorkha Hill Council exists under any law for the time being in force.

instruction: What responsibilities does a village, town, or district officer have regarding property, surveys, assessments, rates, taxes, and documents according to the text?
output: An officer in a village, town or district has the duty to take, receive, keep or expend any property, to make any survey or assessment or to levy any rate or tax for any secular common purpose. They are also in charge of making, authenticating or keeping any document for the ascertaining of the rights of the people.

instruction: Is an act committed by a child under seven years of age considered an offence?
output: No, nothing is an offence which is done by a child under seven years of age.

instruction: When does a Proclamation cease to operate if the House of the People has been dissolved and then reconstituted?
output: The Proclamation shall cease to operate at the expiration of thirty days from the date on which the House of the People first sits after its reconstitution unless a resolution approving the Proclamation has been also passed by the House of the People.

instruction: What should the Magistrate explain to the person before recording their confession?
output: The Magistrate should explain to the person that they are not bound to make a confession and that, if they do so, it may be used as evidence against them.

instruction: What does the law state about offences committed under threats?
output: Except for murder, and offences against the State punishable with death, nothing is an offence which is done by a person who is compelled to do it by threats, which, at the time of doing it, reasonably cause the apprehension that instant death to that person will otherwise be the consequence.

instruction: What is the penalty for dealing with counterfeit Indian coin?
output: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

instruction: Who is authorized to execute the warrant for enforcement?
output: The police officer or another designated person is authorized to execute the warrant for enforcement.

instruction: What roles can determine the successor-in-office of a Magistrate when there is doubt?
output: The Chief Judicial Magistrate, or the District Magistrate, as the case may be.

instruction: What happens if several stolen sacks of corn are made over to A and B, who knew they are stolen property, for the purpose of concealing them?
output: The text does not provide specific charges for this scenario.

instruction: What can the Executive Magistrate direct the officers in command of the armed forces to do to the persons forming part of the assembly?
output: The Executive Magistrate can direct the officers in command of the armed forces to arrest and confine such persons forming part of the assembly.

instruction: What does the Magistrate do with a confession or statement recorded under this section?
output: The Magistrate recording a confession or statement under this section shall forward it to the Magistrate by whom the case is to be inquired into or tried.

instruction: What will the judgments and orders of the Federal Court have after the commencement of this Constitution?
output: They shall have the same force and effect as if they had been delivered or made by the Supreme Court.

instruction: What are the conditions under which an abettor is held liable when a different act is committed than the one abetted?
output: The abettor is held liable for the different act done if it was a probable consequence of the abetment, and was committed under the influence of the instigation, or with the aid or in pursuance of the conspiracy which constituted the abetment. In such cases, the abettor is liable in the same manner and to the same extent as if he had directly abetted it.

instruction: What is the punishment for giving false information respecting an offence committed?
output: The punishment is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What actions or knowledge would make a person a member of an unlawful assembly?
output: A person is considered a member of an unlawful assembly if they, being aware of facts which render any assembly an unlawful assembly, intentionally join that assembly, or continue in it.

instruction: Which law is associated with the offence of promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, caste or community or any other ground, and doing acts that are prejudicial to the maintenance of harmony?
output: The offence of promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, caste or community or any other ground, and doing acts prejudicial to the maintenance of harmony is under 153A.

instruction: What may the Magistrate order if a person fails to pay the compensation ordered under sub-section (2)?
output: The Magistrate may further order that, in default of payment, the person ordered to pay such compensation shall undergo simple imprisonment for a period not exceeding thirty days.

instruction: What does it mean for a case to be recognisable by a court and can be investigated by a police officer without the order of a magistrate?
output: It means that the case is a cognizable case.

instruction: What territories does Haryana comprise of?
output: The territories specified in sub-section (1) of section 3 of the Punjab Reorganisation Act, 1966 and the territories specified in clause (a) of subsection (1) of section 4 of the Haryana and Uttar Pradesh (Alteration of Boundaries) Act, 1979, but excluding the territories specified in clause (v) of sub-section.

instruction: What can be inferred if a person caused a document to be made and an offence under subsection (1) has been charged?
output: If a person's name appears on that document, it can be presumed they are related to the offence.

instruction: What is the minimum years of practice as an advocate required to be appointed as a Public Prosecutor or an Additional Public Prosecutor under sub-section (1), (2), (3) or (6)?
output: Not less than seven years

instruction: When was S. 327 renumbered as sub-section (1)?
What types of cases does the Court of Session or Magistrate of the first class have jurisdiction over?
output: Defamation cases

instruction: What happens to an order made by the Governor under sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph 15?
output: The order, along with the reasons for it, shall be laid before the Legislature of the State as soon as possible. The order will continue in force for a period of twelve months from the date it was made, unless revoked by the Legislature of the State.

instruction: What does section 295 refer to?
output: Injuring or defiling place of work ship, with intent to insult the religion of any class.

instruction: What is the time limit for the inquiry under this section to be completed?
output: The inquiry under this section shall be completed within a period of six months from the date of its commencement.

instruction: What is the consequence of fraudulently causing a decree or order to be passed for a sum not due?
output: The person can be punished with imprisonment of up to two years, or with a fine, or with both.

instruction: What are the qualifications for membership of Parliament?
output: A person must be a citizen of India, make and subscribe an oath before some person authorised by the Election Commission, and possess other qualifications as prescribed by law. They must be at least thirty years of age for a seat in the Council of States, and at least twenty-five years of age for a seat in the House of the People.

instruction: What can the Magistrate do if they direct a local investigation under section 139?
output: The Magistrate may furnish written instructions.

instruction: What is the punishment in a case where declaration has been made under sub-section (4) of section 82 of this Code pronouncing a person as proclaimed offender?
output: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

instruction: What is the appropriate process for an officer in charge of a jail when security is tendered to him?
output: If the security is tendered to the officer, he should immediately refer the matter to the Court or Magistrate who made the order, and then await their instructions.

instruction: What is the category of the offence for failing to appear at specified place and time as per section 82?
output: Cognizable, Non-bailable, and triable by a Magistrate of the first class.

instruction: Who, according to the text, is considered guilty even if the act is not committed?
output: Person A

instruction: What is the form of oath or affirmation to be made by the Judges of a High Court in India?
output: "I, A.B., having been appointed Chief Justice (or a Judge) of the High Court at (or of) ………-….. do swear in the name of God that I will bear solemnly affirm true faith and allegiance to the Constitution of India as by law established, that I will uphold the sovereignty and integrity of India, that I will duly and faithfully and to the best of my ability, knowledge and judgment perform the duties of my office without fear or favour, affection or ill-will and that I will uphold the Constitution and the laws."

instruction: What portion of the evidence is included in the charge when A is accused of giving false evidence?
output: The charge includes that portion of the evidence given by A which is alleged to be false.

instruction: Which section deals with appeals from convictions under sections 344, 345, 349 and 350?
output: Section 351 deals with appeals from convictions under these sections.

instruction: What does the power to hold investigation or preliminary inquiry refer to in legal terms?
output: In legal terms, the power to hold investigation or preliminary inquiry refers to Section 159.

instruction: What acts or omissions are considered as offences under the law made by the Legislature of a State?
output: Making a false return or furnishing false information, not furnishing any information required, disobeying any summons, requisition or lawful written order issued under the provisions of the State Act, failing to pay to a co-operative society amount deducted from its employee within a specified period, failing to handover custody of books, accounts, documents, records, cash, security and other property belonging to a co-operative society to an authorised person.

instruction: What is the number associated with Delhi?
Who are the two members chosen by the Legislative Council of every State having such Council?
output: The Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Legislative Council

instruction: If a police officer apprehends a murder suspect without a warrant, does this fall within the general exception of their legal duty, thus not constituting wrongful confinement?
output: Yes, a police officer apprehending a murder suspect without a warrant falls within the general exception of their legal duty, thus it does not constitute wrongful confinement.

instruction: What might a Criminal Court do to a person who refuses to answer questions or produce documents?
output: Such Court may sentence him to simple imprisonment, or commit him to the custody of an officer of the Court for any term not exceeding seven days.

instruction: What happens if the total number of Ministers in any State exceeds the said fifteen per cent at the commencement of the Constitution (Ninety-first Amendment) Act, 2003?
output: The total number of Ministers in that State shall be brought in conformity with the provisions of this clause within six months from such date as the President may by public notification appoint

instruction: Which schedule includes small scale industries, food processing industries, and Khadi, village, and cottage industries?
output: The Eleventh Schedule includes these industries.

instruction: What actions are considered as making a false document or false electronic record?
output: Making, signing, sealing, executing a document, transmitting an electronic record, affixing an electronic signature on any electronic record, or making any mark denoting the execution of a document or authenticity of the electronic signature are considered as making a false document.

instruction: Who performs the duties of the office when the office of Speaker is vacant?
output: The Deputy Speaker or other person

instruction: What is the Judge required to do if he/she believes there is not sufficient ground for proceeding against the accused?
output: The Judge shall discharge the accused and record his reasons for so doing.

instruction: What is the penalty for someone who has been found guilty of counterfeiting currency-notes or bank-notes?
output: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: What is the Governor not allowed to assent to?
output: The Governor shall not assent to, but shall reserve for the consideration of the President, any Bill which in the opinion of the Governor would, if it became law, so derogate from the powers of the High Court as to endanger the position which that Court is by this Constitution designed to fill.

instruction: What could be the possible consequences if someone dishonestly or fraudulently conceals or removes any property of himself or any other person?
output: The possible consequences could be imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What does section 156 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, pertain to?
output: Section 156 pertains to the power of a police officer to investigate a cognizable case without the order of a Magistrate.

instruction: What can the Magistrate do to make a person who made an accusation appear and show cause?
output: The Magistrate can direct the issue of a summons to him to appear and show cause if he is not present.

instruction: Can a statement or any record of it be utilized at any inquiry or trial without any specific provisions?
output: No

instruction: What happens to the taxes and duties referred to in the Union List?
output: All taxes and duties referred to in the Union List, except those specified, shall be levied and collected by the Government of India and shall be distributed between the Union and the States in the manner provided in clause (2).

instruction: What is the punishment for the offence of adultery?
output: The punishment for the offence of adultery is imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What is meant by 'good faith'?
output: Nothing is said to be done or believed in 'good faith' which is done or believed without due care and attention.

instruction: What is the state's role in workers' participation in management?
output: The State shall take steps, by suitable legislation or in any other way, to secure the participation of workers in the management of undertakings, establishments or other organisations engaged in any industry.

instruction: What are licences or leases for the purpose of prospecting for, or extraction of, minerals related to?
output: They relate to the share of the royalties accruing each year from these licences or leases.

instruction: What is the Maharashtra Act 16 of 1985?
output: The Maharashtra Abolition of Subsisting Proprietary Rights to Mines and Minerals in certain Lands Act, 1985

instruction: What does section 378 cover?
output: Theft.

instruction: What will happen to the reservation of seats for the Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and the representation of the Anglo-Indian community after a certain period?
output: The provisions of the Constitution relating to the reservation of seats for the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes, and the representation of the Anglo-Indian community by nomination, will cease to have effect on the expiration of a period of eighty years in respect of clause (a) and seventy years in respect of clause (b) from the commencement of this Constitution.

instruction: What is the punishment for the crime described in section 476?
output: The punishment is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: What can the President do by order when he identifies a necessity to remove a difficulty in implementing the provisions of an article?
output: The President may do anything (including any adaptation or modification of any other article) which appears to him to be necessary for the purpose of removing that difficulty.

instruction: What are the requirements for a citizen of India to be eligible for election as a member of the House of the People?
output: The person must have completed the age of thirty-five years and must be qualified for election as President according to the Constitution of India.

instruction: What is the force and effect of an Ordinance promulgated under a certain article?
output: It has the same force and effect as an Act of Parliament.

instruction: What will a Magistrate do if a person is not present in Court, either free or in custody?
output: The Magistrate shall issue a summons requiring him to appear, or, when such person is in custody, a warrant directing the officer in whose custody he is to bring him before the Court.
